data.text:
There is no better practitioner of 'political healing' so to speak than @moniguzman & no more brilliant psychological analyst of our divisions than @JonHaidt 

They come together in an epic clash of wisdom in this episode of the @braverangels Podcast:

https://t.co/BszVJ8QboU
@JeffOnTheRight @keithsklar Seems like it. It feels like the type of thing you say when you’re no longer really trying to reach people.
@JayChubby @JeffOnTheRight Absolutely do.

@KyleB1776 @JeffOnTheRight @POTUS Sure, you can accuse Joe Biden of being an opportunistic politician. He also served under the first Black president. Maybe that is all of a pattern if you think the guy just panders.

But he was never a Klan member, never espoused that view. Does Biden justify this huge claim?

@keithsklar @JeffOnTheRight Like any major party the Democratic Party is made up of factions, regional interests, and ideologies that are different and often opposed to each other. Northern Democrats favored civil rights overwhelmingly during the movement (and in any event half of Black ppl voted D since…

@keithsklar @JeffOnTheRight Yes but if we’re studying history I think it’s important to be clear. The Democratic Party dates back to Thomas Jefferson (certainly Andrew Jackson), long before the Klan.

Later some southern democrats founded and joined the Klan. But does that make it OF the Klan? See my point?

Brother Leo,

In your heart of hearts, do you believe your average Democrat, or democratic member of congress even, subscribes to the worldview of the Ku Klux Klan?
 
I doubt it.

Who does this help then? Who does this convince?

What is the goal of a statement like this? Clicks? https://t.co/O9qV6qtUey
@IonaItalia Do you have a strong opinion on polyamory?
@Aella_Girl That feels right of course.
@discountmage @YouHadOneJ0B I may have lost it in an Uber but I think it’s probably in some stupidly obvious place at home.

Flying across the country after realizing I had lost my wallet just before boarding the plane 😫

Had to cancel all my cards, take a later flight w a connection now delayed, putting me in my destination in the wee hours of the morning.

Annoying…but still 1st world problems. 🤷🏽‍♂️

Here’s a question for @Aella_Girl (who I think is very thoughtful and interesting)

Is sex generally better when romantic love is involved (and is there research to this effect)?

One might think the answer here is obvious - but perhaps not?

urls.title: Film Discussion - "The Pruitt Igoe Myth" (BA National)
urls.description: Watch a movie on your own, then attend a discussion of it made richer by the wide variety of viewpoints that participants hold.

tweets.text:
📽️ Heard of The Pruitt-Igoe Myth?

It's a doc about how the American city transformed in the decades after World War II through the lens of the Pruitt-Igoe housing development + the St. Louis residents who called it home. 

We're discussing it on Dec. 12! https://t.co/4KY56qdeIl

Husbands and wives have been communicating and connecting for millennia with little understanding. Parents and children, the same. Yet, communication is commonplace, and the connections are powerful. 
What you're saying is just a deepity. https://t.co/fF5gcHasME

@JohnRWoodJr @braverangels Is there such a thing as “blondness”? Do people identify as “brown-eyed” and brown-eyedness? Love your work w/ braverangels. But none of these identity things make any sense. It’s all silly junk for “intellectuals” to waste their time on without really being helpful in reality
@JohnRWoodJr @moniguzman In other words; our truth matters more than The True. This mindset is largely what's wrong with modern western culture.

For more: https://t.co/YY5WfdqEFK https://t.co/CdEM7edALD

I'm not right-wing or left-wing, no matter how much either side attacks. In the end, we're one. I love you all.

For podcasts, I am trying my best to have honest, empathetic conversations with voices on the left & the right, each time steelmanning their case & the opposing case.

@JohnRWoodJr @lexfridman YES!!! Amazing. My new favorite Podcast… after BraverAngels of course.

What we need now more than ever is daring, courageous art but instead we get censored art and fearful artists.

This project is our answer to the emptiness in today’s art world: https://t.co/ZFr1O4ng6I
@StrangelEdweird I mean: does it stick?

Concept creep appears asymmetric. Terms that categorize experience as negative are expanding territories, and the divides within them degrade (e.g. all instances of violence treated as nearer and nearer to each other). Terms for positive experience do not creep or not as well.

urls.title: No one wins: America's culture wars are a losing fight for Democrats and Republicans alike
urls.description: Comedian Dave Chappelle is highly controversial, but he's also highly popular. And he could be America's best-known opponent of cancel culture.

tweets.text:
"Perhaps the way forward is for the great majority of us caught in the middle to insist on grappling with the complexity of most issues while demonstrating the willingness to disagree amicably whenever possible." 

@JohnRWoodJr for @USATODAY https://t.co/NyaOIDvsRM

urls.title: How To Be A Better Human
urls.description: How To Be A Better Human isn’t your average self improvement podcast. Each week join Chris Duffy in conversation with guests as they uncover insights on how you can be a better human.

tweets.text:
"We're so divided, we're blinded."

@moniguzman explains why, even though we care about facts and truth, "we’re not seeing the truth of other people."

How have you seen this come up in your own life? Whose "truth" have you missed?

To hear more, head to: https://t.co/gd9cGpYpde https://t.co/ceCG0wSvou

As a kid I was obsessed—I mean OBSESSED—with three things:

1. Superheroes
2. Dinosaurs
3. Martial Arts

As such, the Mighty Morphin’ Power Rangers TV show was irresistible to me—and the Green Ranger was the coolest.

#RIP Jason David Frank. Thanks for the joy and adventure. https://t.co/UE21QnMQco
"Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a battle you know nothing about."

annotations.normalized_text: I Never Thought of It That Way: How to Have Fearlessly Curious Conversations in

tweets.text: I enjoyed reading "I Never Thought of It That Way: How to Have Fearlessly Curious Conversations in Dangerously Divided Times" by @moniguzman. Engaging stories along with evidence-based strategies for productive dialogue. Super useful book as we all prepare for the holidays!

Just over 1 in 10 Americans stopped talking to a family member because of something they said about government + politics (@amersurveyctr). 

There's a better way to navigate these conversations. Join us Nov. 26 at 2pmET to learn how to bridge the divide. https://t.co/w3l7ZyjEnG
Twitter before Elon vs Twitter after Elon https://t.co/rnhsgWc2IN
@Aella_Girl he’s not gonna ask people about their kinks aella

"Democracy must be built through open societies that share information. When there is information, there is enlightenment. When there is debate, there are solutions." - Atifete Jahjaga https://t.co/BYFjY2yPbk
I'd like to talk to Trump on podcast. Make it a tough, raw, honest conversation. Maybe it'll help Twitter decide if to bring him back.

I simply refuse to live in a culture where I'm supposed to see all our problems and differences as signs of Evil.

I will continue to live in a culture where I extend and expect good faith by default; even if that culture exists only in my head, the alternative is still worse.

Has Hollywood gone anti-woke??? 

I can’t believe what I’ve just seen https://t.co/jslWEzqzgG
Meet Stacia Wilson (@OriginalStacia), the founder & editor-in-chief of 2ndLook News...  🧵↓ https://t.co/3hKRlfSN53
Raw milk extremism
We think so too. https://t.co/XoAI2I4fpL
What did I do to deserve this?!?!? https://t.co/WAUTKieAv1

Elon Musk is firing everyone who criticizes him at Twitter. Right-wing free speech advocates are always the first to srike down their critics. They want to protect their speech, not yours. They love cancel culture when they're the ones doing the canceling.

urls.title: Perspective: Republicans and Democrats have different fears about elections. That’s all the more reason they should talk
urls.description: Political opposites often work with different information. Once information is shared, solutions — and even friendships — are possible

tweets.text: "If our republic is to thrive... we will need to follow the leadership of the men and women who have had the courage to walk into these conversations with their 'enemies' and walk out with both friendships and solutions in hand." @AprilALawson https://t.co/HD5AXTfbR5

Imagine: you're at a family gathering sitting around the dinner table when suddenly one of your relatives says something you find problematic.

Should you call them out? 

Join us Nov. 17 at 8pmET for a debate on how to handle this during the holidays! https://t.co/50vIV37h46

urls.title: Play recording: Hold America Together: Overcoming divides in a post-midterms America.
urls.description: Starts With Us’s Space · Where live audio conversations happen

tweets.text:
"We are in this amazing moment where there is a grassroots movement, there is grassroots energy building up around bringing the American people together to transcend our divisions." - @JohnWoodJr

Join the conversation here: https://t.co/X8mC7lKDc1 #HoldAmericaTogether

I’m so glad I was invited to this great discussion. I’m realistic — the challenges are enormous — but more so, I’m hopeful. Take a listen as we dive into the systemic forces dividing Americans (and consider how we all may help fight those forces). https://t.co/eHSFFnp7Fa

Join TPN members @manumeel1, @JohnRWoodJr, and @andrewyang, in conversation about political depolarization with @braverangels, @BridgeUSA_, @StartsWithUs, @DanielLubetzky, @bungarsargon, @JaRonSmith04, and @arianapekary on Twitter Spaces event today at 4:30pm ET.👇 https://t.co/ZX2lh6c2vm
